result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin A. Picchietti was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Stipulation agreement for custody credit (faxed to Judge Harrington 1/13/17 at 2:27 PM)

Defendant Justin A. Picchietti in court with attorney brian paul karalus. Prosecuting Atty Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Atty Karalus argues for reinstatement of Huber and return of Good TIme. Makes motion regarding days in custody credit.
State addresses court re reinstatement of Huber and return of Good Time. Gives argument. 
Court denies motion for reinstatement of Huber. Court orders loss of 7 days of Good Time. Denies motion regarding days in custody. Atty to get with State to settle. May stipulate.
Hearing on January 5, 2017 at 10:30 am.

3:45 p.m.  DE J.Picchietti appears by video from jail to the Washburn County Courthouse for scheduled hearing regarding revocation of Huber.  DA Poquette appears by telephone.  Atty Karalus was attempted to be called by the court to appear as arranged.  Judge denies further action until defense attorney can appear.

Request for Loss of Good Time, Request for Revocation/Suspension of Huber and Order.
7 days of lost good time and revocation of Huber
Request for Revocation/Suspension of Huber sent (faxed) to Judge Harrington

records.descr: Corrected Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: No restitution to be ordered per District Attorney.

Defendant Justin A. Picchietti in court with attorney Brian Paul Karalus. Defendant Justin A. Picchietti in custody. Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
2:04 Case called. Parties state: no additions or corrections to PSI. State argues sentencing. DEF argues sentencing. Court addresses Def. Def does not  make statement.
Court addresses parties. Court orders 9 months county jail, with Huber priveledges and good time, 103 days credit for time served. A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Remanded to Sawyer County Jail.

Emailed to Judge.
